info.title: AllOf API
info.description:
# Overview

The API endpoints are developed around [RESTful](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Representational_state_transfer) principles secure via the OAuth2.0 protocol.

Beyond the entry points, the API also provides a line of communication into your system via [webhooks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Webhook).

For testing purposes, we offer a staging environment. Also, more detailed information about the business rules and workflows can be found on the [**Documentation Section**](/docs/)

## Versioning
Each API is versioned individually, but we follow these rules:
- Non breaking changes (eg: adding new fields) are added in the current version without previous communication
- Breaking changes (fields removal, semantic changed or schema update) have the version incremented
- Users will be notified about new versions and will be given time to migrate (the time will be set on a case by case)
- Once users migrate to the new version, we will deprecate the old ones
- Once there is a new version for an API, we won't accept new integrations targeting old versions

## API General Definitions
The APIs use resource-oriented URLs communicating, primarily, via JSON and leveraging the HTTP headers, [response status codes](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Status), and verbs.

To exemplify how the API is to be consumed, consider a fake GET resource endpoint invocation below:

```
curl --request GET 'https://{{public-api-url}}/v1/resource/123' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer 34fdabeeafds=' --header 'X-Store-Id: 321'
```

|      Header      | Description |
| ---------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|`Authorization`   | Standard HTTP header is used to associate the request with the originating invoker. The content of this header is a `Bearer` token generated from you client_secret, defined in the [API Auth](#/section/Guides/API-Auth) guide.|
|`X-Store-Id`      | The ID of the store in your system this call acts on behalf of. |

_All resource endpoints expect the `Authorization` header, the remaining headers are explicitly stated in the individual endpoint documentation section._

With these headers, the system will:
 - Validate the client token, making sure the call is originating from a trusted source.
 - Validate that the Application has the permission to access the `v1/resource/{id}` resource via the Application's pre-configured scopes.
 - Translate your X-Store-Id to our internal store ID (e.g. `AAA`).
 - Validate and retrieve resource `AAA`, that is associated to your Application via store id `321`.

POST/PUT methods will look similar to the GET calls, but they'll take in a body in the HTTP request (default to the application/json content-type).

```
curl --location --request POST 'https://{{public-api-url}}/v1/resource' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer 34fdabeeafds=' --header 'X-Store-Id: 321'
--data '{"foo": "bar"}'
```

## API Authentication/Authorization

<SecurityDefinitions />

The **Authorization API** is based on the [OAuth2.0 protocol](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749), using the [client credentials grant](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-4.4). Resources expect a valid token sent as a `Bearer` token in the HTTP `Authorization` header.

To generate the token, use the `Application ID` and `Client Secret` (provided during onboarding) to the [Token Auth endpoint](#operation/requestToken) endpoint. The result of this invocation is a token that is valid for a pre-determined time or until it is manually revoked.

The response of the following endpoints will return a token that will be sent as a `Bearer` value of the `Authorization` HTTP header, along with meta information such as expiry-date.

_Note that the referred `client_id` is the `Application ID` because though we chose adhere to the OAuth2.0 standard for the auth APIs._

### Request Examples

#### URL Encoded Form

The API exposes a token generation endpoint expects your *client_id* and *client_secret* to be formatted as *application/x-www-form-urlencoded* content type.
```
curl --location --request POST 'https://{{public-api-url}}/v1/auth/token' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' \
--data-urlencode 'scope=ping' \
--data-urlencode 'grant_type=client_credentials' \
--data-urlencode 'client_id=[APPLICATION_ID]' \
--data-urlencode 'client_secret=[CLIENT_SECRET]'
```

#### HTTP Basic Auth

Alternatively, the API also accepts a `Basic` Authorization header with the Base64 encoding of the `client_id` (`Application ID`) and `client_secret` joined by a single colon `:`.

```
BASE64_ENCODED_CREDENTIALS = base64_encode(client_id + ":" + client_secret)
```

```
curl --location --request POST 'https://{{public-api-url}}/v1/auth/token' \
--header 'Authorization: Basic [BASE64_ENCODED_CREDENTIALS]' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' \
--data-urlencode 'scope=ping' \
--data-urlencode 'grant_type=client_credentials'
```

## Webhook

The Public API is able to send notifications to your system via HTTP POST requests.

Every webhook is signed using HMAC-SHA256 that is present in the header `X-HMAC-SHA256`, and you can also authenticate the requests using Basic Auth, Bearer Token or HMAC-SHA1 (legacy). Please, refer to [**Webhook Authentication Guide**](/docs/guides-webhook-authentication/) for more details.

_Please work with your Account Representative to setup your Application's Webhook configurations._

```
Example Base-URL = https://{{your-server-url}}/webhook
```

### Notification Schema

| **Name**                | **Type** | **Description**                                                      |
| ------------------------| ---------| -------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| eventId                 | string   | Unique id of the event.                                              |
| eventTime               | string   | The time the event occurred.                                         |
| eventType               | string   | The type of event (e.g. create_order).                               |
| metadata.storeId        | string   | Id of the store for which the event is being published.              |
| metadata.applicationId  | string   | Id of the application for which the event is being published.        |
| metadata.resourceId     | string   | The external identifier of the resource that this event refers to.   |
| metadata.resourceHref   | string   | The endpoint to fetch the details of the resource.                   |
| metadata.payload        | object   | The event object which will be detailed in each Webhook description. |

### Notification Request Example

```
curl --location --request POST 'https://{{your-server-url}}/webhook' \
--header 'User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_14_5) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/75.0.3770.142 Safari/537.36' \
--header 'Authorization: MAC <hash signature>' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--data-raw '{
   "eventId": "123456",
   "eventTime": "2020-10-10T20:06:02:123Z",
   "eventType": "orders.new_order",
   "metadata": {
      "storeId": "755fd19a-7562-487a-b615-171a9f89d669",
      "applicationId": "e22f94b3-967c-4e26-bf39-9e364066b68b",
      "resourceHref": "https://{{public-api-url}}/v1/orders/bf9f1d81-f213-496e-a026-91b6af44996c",
      "resourceId": "bf9f1d81-f213-496e-a026-91b6af44996c",
      "payload": {}
   }
}
```

## Expected Response

The partner application should return an HTTP 200 response code with an empty response body to acknowledge receipt of the webhook event.
## Rate Limiting
Please, refer to [**Rate Limiting Guide**](/docs/guides-rate-limiting/) for more details.

post.summary: Order Handed Off status notification webhook

post.description: Used to validate the integration without side effects

Sent when a store is created or updated in `Public API` internal systems.
If metadata contains a `Store ID`, it means a request to update an existent store, otherwise, it's a creation operation.
It provides the store and credentials data needed to validate the store and create a new `Store ID` in the partner application.
At this point, the store is in `onboarding state` waiting the partner application to finish the onboarding process by providing the validated `Store ID`.

409.description: The provided credentials already exists in another store.

422.description: The provided credentials are not compatible with the provided schema version.

2XX.description: The provided credentials are compatible with the provided schema version, successfully saved in the partner application database and available for the validation process (establishing a connection with the service related to the Application ID, e.g.: UberEats).

post.description: Synchronously returns the last version of the credentials schema needed to create and validate a store in the partner application. If the request contains the `Store ID`, it also returns the saved store credentials corresponding to the provided `Store ID`.

200.description: The credentials schema and, if the request contains the Store ID, the correspondent store credentials.

202.description: The order status was successfully accepted.

put.description:
`RATE LIMIT: 8 per minute`

Notice that this operation do not completely replace the existent customer payment, instead, it overwrites the field if the latest update is a non-null value. If the update value is null, the existent value will continue to be used.

200.description: The order payment information was successfully updated.

202.description: The order delivery information was successfully accepted.

post.description: `RATE LIMIT: 32 per minute`; orders must have a status of FULFILLED, REJECTED, or CANCELED

202.description: The order status was successfully accepted.

post.description: Client credentials in the request-body and HTTP Basic Auth are supported.

`RATE LIMIT: 2 per minute`

The asynchronous callback of the Upsert Store Webhook. The partner application will use this endpoint  to inform if the store data and credentials provided through the `Upsert Store Webhook` were enough to  create/update and validate the store. If informing success, the `Store ID` must be provided to  complete the store onboarding process. If informing failure, use the `Error Message` field to provide  details about the problem.

204.description: If informing success, it means the store onboarding process is complete. If informing failure, it means new credentials need to be provided through the Upsert Store Webhook.

put.description:
`RATE LIMIT: 2 per minute`

The partner application should call this endpoint when needing to change the status of a store that already completed the onboarding process.

204.description: The store status was successfully updated.

202.description: The financial transaction for the order was successfully processed.

post.description: Post a financial invoice containing payout and financial data for orders in a given period of time.

202.description: The financial transaction for the order was successfully processed.

OAuth2.0.description:
The Authentication/Authorization API support OAuth2.0 protocol. Only Generate Token operation is supported.

## Scopes

Scopes must be configured by our internal team to be enabled for an app. Each endpoint requires a given scope that can be verified on each endpoint documentation. When generating an OAuth2.0 token multiple scopes can be requested.

## Generate Token

Used to generate an OAuth2.0 token that must be used to call all available endpoints.
Client credentials in the request-body and HTTP Basic Auth are supported.

### Request

Request body schema: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

### Specification

| **Field**                | **Type**        | **Description** |
| ------------------------ | --------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| client_id                | string <uuid>   | The error description. |
| client_secret            | string          | The secret of the client.                                                             |
| grant_type               | string          | The OAuth2.0 grant types supported. Must be client_credentials.                    |
| scope                    | string          | The scope to request, multiple scopes are passed delimited by a space character. |

### Example

```
curl --location --request POST 'https://{{public-api-url}}/v1/auth/token' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' \
  --data-urlencode 'scope=ping' \
  --data-urlencode 'grant_type=client_credentials' \
  --data-urlencode 'client_id=[APPLICATION_ID]' \
  --data-urlencode 'client_secret=[CLIENT_SECRET]'
```

### Response

Response body schema: application/json

### Specification

| **Field**                | **Type**        | **Description** |
| ------------------------ | --------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| access_token             | string          | The OAuth2.0 generated token.                                                   |
| expires_in               | integer         | Time for token expiration, in seconds.                                              |
| scope                    | string          | Scopes available for the generated token.                                         |
| token_type               | string          | The token type, value is always `bearer`.                                         |

### Example

```
{
  "access_token": "oMahtBwBbnZeh4Q66mSuLFmk2V0_CLCKVt0aYcNJlcg.yditzjwCP7yp0PgR6AzQR3wQ1rTdCjkcPeAMuyfK-NU",
  "expires_in": 2627999,
  "scope": "ping orders.create",
  "token_type": "bearer"
}
```

### Error Responses

HTTP Status Code `400`: The request is malformed.

HTTP Status Code `401`: Invalid Authorization.

HTTP Status Code `422`: The request body is not valid.

### Example

```
{
  "message": "Client Secret and Authorization header are null.",
  "details": []
}
```

## Usage

The token provided in field `access_token` is used to authenticate when consuming the API endpoints. Send the token value in the `Authorization` header of every request. The token expiration time is represented in the field `expired_in`, in seconds. Currently, all tokens are valid for 30 days and should be stored and re-used while still valid.

### Example

```
curl --location --request GET 'https://{{public-api-url}}/v1/ping' \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer <access_token>' \
  --header 'X-Store-Id: <storeId>'
```

scopes.menus.publish: Token has permission to notify the result of a publish menus operation for a given store.
scopes.menus.get_current: Token has permission to send the current state of a menu, after being requested by a webhook event.
scopes.menus.upsert_hours: Token has permission to notify the receiving of the upsert hours menu event, after being requested by a webhook event.
scopes.menus.pos_publish: Token has permission to read available integration targets and to publish complete menus for selected integration targets.
scopes.menus.async_job.read: Token has permission to read the status of a menu upsert job.
scopes.menus.entity_suspension: Token has permission to notify the result of a menu entity availability update, after being requested by a webhook event.
scopes.menus.read: Token has permission to read the current menus for a given store.
scopes.menus.upsert: Token has permission to create/update menus for a given store.
scopes.orders.customer_payment_update: Token has permission to update customers payment information for a previously created order for a given store.
scopes.orders.delivery_info_update: Token has permission to update delivery information for a previously created order.
scopes.orders.status_update: Token has permission to update the order status for a previously created order.
scopes.orders.create: Token has permission to create new order for a given store.
scopes.orders.update: Token has permission to create and update new orders for a given store.
scopes.ping: Token has permission to ping the system.
scopes.reports.generate_report: Token has permission to request reports for given store(s) and period of time.
scopes.storefront.store_pause_unpause: Token has permission to notify the result of a pause/unpause operation, after being requested by a webhook event.
scopes.storefront.store_availability: Token has permission to send the current state of store.
scopes.storefront.store_hours_configuration: Token has permission to send the current store hours configuration.
scopes.delivery.provider: Token has permission to send the delivery operation result.
scopes.callback.error.write: Token has permission to send failed webhook event results.
scopes.stores.manage: Allow the use of stores' endpoints and webhooks.

StoreId.description: The unique identifier of the store in the partner application. This ID, along with the `Application ID`, will be used to match the correct store when performing operations. It cannot be longer than 255 characters and must only contain printable ASCII characters.

id.description: Unique ID for the order that was placed.

friendlyId.description: ID used for driver pickup and restaurant management.

source.description: Describes the source of the order, typically from a food ordering marketplace.

id.description: Unique ID for the order that was placed.

friendlyId.description: ID used for driver pickup and restaurant management.

source.description: Describes the source of the order, typically from a food ordering marketplace.

quantity.description: The number of times the modifier was applied to the given item.

skuPrice.description: The stored sku price of this item

id.description: The unique ID of the modifier product.

name.description: The name of the modifier as displayed to the customer.

price.description: The price of the sold modifier.

groupName.description: The parent group of the modifier item

groupId.description: The unique ID of the parent group

modifiers.description: Nested modifiers applied to the item.

quantity.description: The quantity of the item ordered by the customer.

skuPrice.description: The stored sku price of this item

id.description: The unique ID of the item.

name.description: The name of the item as displayed to the customer.

note.description: An optional item-level note provided by the customer.

categoryId.description: The unique ID of the category of this item.

categoryName.description: The name of the category of this item.

price.description: The price of the sold item.

PersonalIdentifiers.description: The person's personal identifiers (e.g. tax identification number).

name.description: The person's name as it should be displayed.

phoneCode.description: A code or extension of the phone number.

name.description: The person's name as it should be displayed.

phoneCode.description: A code or extension of the phone number.

Location.description: Latitude and longitude of the address.

fullAddress.description: Full, human comprehensible address. It is usually formatted in the order appropriate for your locale.
fullAddress.example: 123 Sample Street Ste 100, San Francisco, CA 94103

city.description: The city/town portion of the address.

state.description: Highest administrative subdivision which is used for postal addresses of a country or region. For example, this can be a state, a province, or a prefecture.

addressLines.description: Address lines (e.g. street, PO Box, or company name) or the full single line address (e.g. street, city, state, country, zip).
example: 123 Sample Street Ste 100, San Francisco, CA 94103

linesOfAddress.description: Deprecated: use addressLines. Address lines (e.g. street, PO Box, or company name) or the full single line address (e.g. street, city, state, country, zip).
example: 123 Sample Street Ste 100, San Francisco, CA 94103

licensePlate.description: License plate of a vehicle used by the courier.

makeModel.description: Make and model of a vehicle used by the courier.

subtotal.description: The order's subtotal, as the sum of all item and modifier prices.

claimedSubtotal.description: The order's claimed subtotal, without guaranteeing this will match calculated subtotal.

discount.description: Any discount amount for the order.

total.description: Order total including everything paid by the customer.

couponCode.description: Coupon code applied to the order.

OrderTotal.description: Details about values of the order.

breakdown.description: Breakdown values for the finance line.

CompositeFinanceLine.description: composite finance line can represent a value, tax and VAT for a given line as a list of SimpleFinanceLine objects

foodSales.description: Breakdown of the total value of items within the order.

feeForRestaurantProvidedDelivery.description: Extra charge to the customer when order is delivered by the store itself.

adjustments.description: Any adjustments that may happen to the order total value.

packingFee.description: Fee charged to the customer for the process of packing and fulfilling the order.

bagFee.description: Fee charged to the customer for providing bags for the order.

serviceProviderDiscount.description: Discount funded by the service provider (order source).

tipForServiceProviderCourier.description: Tip for the courier from the service provider.

feeForServiceProviderDelivery.description: Fee charged to the customer for a delivery provided by the service provider.

smallOrderFee.description: Fee charged to the customer when the order value is less than the minimum value.

serviceFee.description: Any service fees charged by the service provider to the customer.

otherFee.description: All the extra costs that the customer has to pay, are different from tips, delivery fees, bag fees, packing fees, and service fees.

netPayout.description: The net payout received by the store.

couponCodes.description: Any codes entered by the customer at order checkout.

FinancialData.description:
Breakdown of order values. Represents total values, fees, discounts, and any possible adjustments that may happen in the order value.

Breakdown lists can be used to represent aggregate values (e.g. order total value) or, when available, can accurately represent the values of each item/fee/tax/charges related to the order.

All objects in breakdown lists have a required property "subType". Allowed values are:

**VALUE**: represent the net value of the order/item/fee. Should be used in the following cases:
 - when the amount does not contain taxes or VAT
 - when tax/VAT is a known value, in that case, the list must contain an object with subtype TAX or VAT representing this value.

**TAX**: represent the tax value for the order/item/fee. Should be used when tax amount is available, in that case, this information should be part of the breakdown list with the "VALUE" as the net amount, example below:


  ```
    "breakdown": [
        {
            "name": "Item 1",
            "value": 10,
            "subType": "VALUE"
        },
        {
            "name": "Item 1 - Tax",
            "value": 2,
            "subType": "TAX"
        }
    ]
  ```


**VAT**: represents the amount for value-added tax. Should be used when the order/item/fee contains VAT. In that case,  this information should be part of the breakdown list with the "VALUE" as net amount, example below:


  ```
    "breakdown": [
        {
            "name": "Item 1",
            "value": 12,
            "subType": "VALUE"
        },
        {
            "name": "Item 1 - Tax",
            "value": 2,
            "subType": "VAT"
        }
    ]
  ```


**VALUE_WITH_TAX**: represents the gross value of the order/item/fee. Should be used when the value includes tax/VAT and values related to taxation are not available.


  ```
    "breakdown": [
        {
            "name": "Item 1",
            "value": 12,
            "subType": "VALUE_WITH_TAX"
        }
    ]
  ```

customerPaymentDue.description: The portion of the overall order cost that will be collected when the order is delivered, or when picked up by the customer at the store. This field should not be set if the order was pre-paid.

customerPrepayment.description: The portion of the overall order cost that was paid upfront by the customer (online payment), with the remaining portion in the customerPaymentDue. In most cases the order value will be covered entirely by prepayment or entirely by payment_due. But in some cases mixing is allowed.

customerAmountToReturn.description:
Change (cash back) to be returned to the customer by the courier or store when the order has payment due value.

 Scenario:
 1. Customer places an order for $7.50.
 2. In the service app, after selecting Cash as payment type, the customer is presented with an additional field to indicate that order will be paid with a single $20 bill.
 3. When the order is delivered, the courier should have $12.50 in cash on hand to complete the transaction.

paymentDueToRestaurant.description: The portion of the overall order cost that was received directly by restaurant/store when the order is delivered or picked up. Should be used when customerPaymentDue is set. If payment due is entirely received by the store, customerPaymentDue and paymentDueToRestaurant will have the same value.

payoutFromServiceProvider.description: Payout amount that will be received from service provider (usually the order source).

payoutFrom3rdParty.description: Payout amount that will be received from any 3rd party organization involved.

cashPayout.description: Payout amount received from orders paid in cash directly to the store.

customerPayment.description: The customer perspective, each price field in this model is meant to represent the values the customer paid/received and how. Values must match amounts and payment methods described in customerPayments.

payout.description: Breakdown of net payout received by the store. Optional object, should be provided when payout information is available during the order lifecycle.

OrderTotalV2.description: V2 for details about values of the order, provides richer objects allowing to capture taxes, misc charges, payments more precisely.

value.description: The portion of the overall amount that needs to be paid.

processingStatus.description: The processing status of the payment.

pickupTime.description: Estimated time (in UTC) that the courier or customer will pick up the order.

deliveryTime.description: Estimated time (in UTC) when the order is expected to be delivered. This should be filled in if FulfillmentMode is delivery.

fulfillmentMode.description: How an order is expected to be fulfilled.

schedulingType.description: Describes whether this order should be cooked as soon as possible, or some time in the future. Please use the pickupTime and/or deliveryTime to indicate when. If no scheduling type is provided, we assume the order should be prepared as soon as possible.

currencyCode.description: The 3-letter currency code (ISO 4217) to use for all monetary values in this order.

orderedAt.description: The date (in UTC) when the order was placed by the customer.

customerNote.description: An order-level note provided by the customer.

customerPayments.description: Details about the payments made by the customer.

Order.description: An order placed by a customer.

message.example: Order Currency Code must be exactly 3 characters

orderStatus.description: The requested status to transition the order to.

OrderStatusUpdateRequest.description: The request to change an order status.

currencyCode.description: The 3-letter currency code (ISO 4217) to use for all monetary values in this order.

customerPayment.description: The requested customer payment to transition the order to.

OrderCustomerPaymentUpdateRequest.description: The request to update customer payment for an order.

contentType.description: The MIME type of the file.

ModifierGroup.title: All ModifierGroups for the Store, indexed by ID

id.description: The identifier that exists in the third party system. During a menu publish event, uuidV4 ids will be generated for new entities that do not yet exist in the internal menu.

minimumSelections.description: Minimum number of selections customers can make in this ModifierGroup. 0 means no min limits.

maximumSelections.description: Maximum number of selections customers can make in this ModifierGroup. 0 means no max limits.

maxPerModifierSelectionQuantity.description: Maximum number of selections customers can make for each modifier item in this ModifierGroup. 0 means there is no limit to how many times they can select a single modifier item. If not specified, a value of 1 will be used as the default value.

itemIds.description: Identifiers of each Item within this ModifierGroup.

description.description: The description for this modifier group.
description.example: Choose any of these delicious types of bagels

ModifierGroup.description: Items are sold on the menu. Modifiers to items are items themselves and their relationship is defined by ModifierGroup.

HourInterval.description: Represents the beginning and ending of operating time for a menu specific to a Day.

Hours.description: Hours are represented as a list of HourIntervals.

currencyCode.description: The 3-letter currency code (ISO 4217) to use for all monetary values.

PercentageValue.example: A decimalValue of 0.513 will equate to 51.3%

chargeType.description: The type of the additional charge.

AdditionalCharge.description: Additional charge to apply. Exactly one of either flatCharge or percentageCharge should be provided.

Menu_POS.title: All Menus for the store, indexed by ID

categoryIds.description: Identifiers of the categories within this Menu.

fulfillmentModes.description: The ways in which this menu may be fulfilled. If no values are specified, it is assumed that all fulfillment types are allowed.

items.description: How an item from a menu is allowed to be fulfilled when ordered by a user.

description.example: Cooking up BBQ deliciousness from around the globe!

additionalCharges.description: Additional charges to apply for this menu. All additional charges specified on a menu will only be applied once per order.

saleStatus.description: The sale status of the item.

suspendedUntil.description: ISO-8601 timestamp representing the time the saleStatus value is supposed to change to FOR_SALE. Set only when current saleStatus value is TEMPORARILY_NOT_FOR_SALE. E.g.: 2020-11-23T21:33:51Z, 2007-12-03T10:15:30+01:00

ItemStatus.description: Represents whether an Item is for sale, indefinitely not for sale, or not for sale until a specific time.

externalServiceSlug.description: The service slug for which this rule should apply. E.g.: If externalServiceSlug is UberEats, then the priceOverride should be applied to UberEats.

OverrideRule.description: Override rule for when to apply price overrides

rules.description: Override rules for when this price override should be applied.

currencyCode.description: The 3-letter currency code (ISO 4217) to use for all monetary values.

SkuBarcode.description: A barcode for the product which may be common types like UPC, GTIN, ASIN or an internal type.

containsAllergen.description: Indication of whether or not the product contains this allergen. If the status of the allergen is unknown, a classification should not be provided for this product.

low.description: The minimum calorie value for an item.

high.description: The maximum calorie value for an item.

EnergyKcal.description: The calorie range of the item. If only one calorie value is known, set both low and high to that value.

NutritionalInfo.description: The nutritional information of an item.

Servings.description: The number of people an item serves. If only one serving value is known, set both min and max to that value.

skuSlug.description: A system-unique, human-readable identifier for the product.

dietaryClassifications.description: All dietary classifications for the product

allergenClassifications.description: All allergen classifications for the product

containsAlcohol.description: Indicates whether or not this product contains alcohol.

nutritionalInfo.description: The nutritional information for the product

servings.description: The number of servings for the product.

SkuDetails.description: Details of the product being prepared or a pre-packaged good being sold. Includes information such as UPC barcode, unique identifiers, or classification information.

percentageValue.description: Specify the percentage value of the tax.

isValueAddedTax.description: Whether this tax is a value-added tax.

MenusUpsertRequest.description: All menus associated with a store.

message.description: Only present if status is FAILED. Contains the error message returned by our menu systems.

MenuPublishJobState.description: Information about the menu publish target.

publishJobState.description: Only present if the MenuJobType is PUBLISH. Contains a map of MenuPublishTarget services to their corresponding statuses.

rappi.message: Failed to publish menu due to error ...

MenuAsynchronousJob.description: The job created to process the menu request.

requestedToCreatedEntityIds.description: A map for entities created by the Upsert containing the IDs of the requested entities mapped to the IDs of entities created by the request. Our system will use the IDs returned in this map to send updates to these entities in future requests. **NOTE -** A empty map can be used on requestedToCreatedEntityIds to use the same menu IDs that were previously defined.

start.description: Start time of the range in 24 hour format.

end.description: End time of the range in 24 hour format.

TimeRange.description: Time range in a given date.

days.description: The day of the week this configuration applies.

timeRanges.description: Hours range applied to the provided day of the week

RegularHours.description: Describes the configuration of regular hours.

date.description: Date the special hour configuration applies.

timeRanges.description: Hours range applied to configured date.

type.description: Store state that should be applied during the configured special hour.

timeZone.description: TimeZone of all times under it. (https://www.joda.org/joda-time/timezones.html)

specialHours.description: List of special hours configuration, for occasions like Christmas, Thanksgiving, or any other holidays.

HoursData.description: Represents hours configuration with regular hours and special hours.

MenuData.description: MenuData contains all menu entities, and their relations.

status.description: The status of a menu publish target.

menuPublishTargets.description: Map of MenuPublishTarget names to their targets. The target can only be published to if the status is READY.

MenuPublishResponseMenuPublishTargets.description: Only present if the request fails. Meant to help debugging why the request failed.

requestSubmitted.description: Whether the request was submitted or not.

jobId.description: Only present if the request succeeds. Job ID to check on the status with the MenuAsyncJob endpoint.

isIndefinite.description: True if the suspension is indefinite

suspendedUntil.description: ISO-8601 timestamp representing the time the saleStatus value is supposed to change to FOR_SALE. Set only when current saleStatus value is TEMPORARILY_NOT_FOR_SALE. E.g.: 2020-11-23T21:33:51Z, 2007-12-03T10:15:30+01:00

SuspensionStatus.description: The type of suspension this will be.

entityIds.description: Entity IDs to suspend. These should be the IDs as you represent them in your system.

note.description: The reason you are suspending the items.

entityIds.description: Entity IDs to unsuspend. These should be the IDs as you represent them in your system.

note.description: The reason you are unsuspending the items.

menuPublishTargets.description: Map of MenuPublishTarget names to their targets. The target can only be published to if the status is READY.

operationStatus.description: Status of the operation requested by an event.

additionalInformation.description: Additional details about the event result, if available.

operationFinishedAt.description: Time when the processing of the event finished.

EventResultMetadata.description: Information about the result of a storefront event.

storeState.description: Represents the current state of a store.

statusChangedAt.description: The time when the store changed to the current state.

StoreAvailabilityEventResult.description: The current state of a store.

startTime.description: Start time of the range in 24 hour format.

endTime.description: End time of the range in 24 hour format.

Storefront_TimeRange.description: Time range in a given date.

timeRanges.description: Hours range applied to the provided day of the week

Storefront_RegularHours.description: Describes the configuration of regular hours.

date.description: Date the special hour configuration applies.

timeRanges.description: Hours range applied to configured date.

specialHourType.description: Store state that should be applied during the configured special hour.

Storefront_SpecialHours.description: Describes the configuration of special store hours.

StoreHours.description: Represents store hours configuration with regular hours and special hours.

timezone.description: The store time zone identifier. (e.g. America/New_York)

StoreHoursConfiguration.description: The current store hours configuration of a store.

statusChangedAt.description: The time when the store hours configuration changed.

operationStatus.description: Status of the operation requested by an event.

additionalInformation.description: Additional details about the event result, if available.

operationFinishedAt.description: Time when the processing of the event finished.

RequiredEventResultMetadata.description: Information about the result of a storefront event.

closureId.description: ID required to unpause a store, if available

PauseStoreEventResult.description: Result of an event that requested to pause a store.

UnpauseStoreEventResult.description: Result of an event that requested to unpause a store.

vehicleType.description: The type of vehicle used to fulfill the delivery.

licensePlate.description: The license plate of the vehicle used to fulfill the delivery.

makeModel.description: The make and model of the vehicle used to fulfill the delivery.

createdAt.description: The time that the update was created.

currencyCode.description: The 3-letter currency code (ISO 4217) to use for all monetary values.

providerDeliveryId.description: The provider's internal identifier for the delivery used for tracking purposes.

type.description: Type of entities in the fulfillment path.

minPickupDuration.description: Minimum time required for courier to arrive at pickup location in minutes It is an estimation.

maxPickupDuration.description: Maximum time that the courier's arrival at pick up location can be delayed. If not provided, it will default to 60 minutes or minPickUpDuration, whichever is greater. This value is an estimation and expressed in minutes.

currencyCode.description: The 3-letter currency code (ISO 4217) to use for all monetary values.

fulfillmentPath.description: List of entities involved in the fulfillment processing path.

createdAt.description: The time that the quote was created.

accountBalance.description: The remaining account balance of the requester for the delivery provider.

currencyCode.description: The 3-letter currency code (ISO 4217) to use for all monetary values.

fulfillmentPath.description: List of entities involved in the fulfillment processing path.

confirmedAt.description: The time that the request was accepted.

deliveryTrackingUrl.description: URL to a web page that tracks the delivery.

providerDeliveryId.description: The provider's internal identifier for the delivery used for tracking purposes.

canceledAt.description: The time that the request was cancelled.

errorCode.description: Errors that occur processing the webhook, modeled after Google's gRPC error codes.

EventCallbackError.description: The error container for a processed callback.

waitTimeOptions.description: Possible wait time durations in minutes

currencyCode.description: The 3-letter currency code (ISO 4217) to use for all monetary values.

fulfillmentPath.description: List of entities involved in the fulfillment processing path.

quotes.description: List of currently available delivery quotes.

quoteId.description: Quote id from the requestQuote response.

waitTime.description: Wait time chosen for the delivery.

currencyCode.description: The 3-letter currency code (ISO 4217) to use for all monetary values.

processedTime.description: Time that the delivery was accepted and confirmed.
Time that the delivery was canceled.

CancelDeliveryResponse.description: Details about a cancellation delivery request.

externalServiceSlugs.description: List of external service slugs to fetch orders from. Default to all services

items.description: List of external service slugs to fetch orders from. Default to all services

GenerateReportRequest.description: The request to generate a report.

JobId.description: ID used to track the job created for generating report.

GenerateReportResponse.description: The response to a generate report request

reportUrl.description: Url to download the report. It will be available only if status is "READY"

errorMessage.description: Error message. It will be available only if status is "ERROR"
errorMessage.example: Report generation error. Please reach out to support and provide jobId

externalStoreIds.description: List of external store IDs to filter the orders with. At least one value is required. Max is 5000. Fails the requests if one or more invalid external store ID is passed

items.description: List of external store IDs to filter the orders with. At least one value is required. Fails the requests if one or more invalid external store ID is passed

externalServiceSlugs.description: List of external service slugs to fetch orders from. Default to all services

items.description: List of external service slugs to fetch orders from. Default to all services

GenerateReportMultiRequest.description: The request to generate a report for multiple stores.

client_id.description: The ID of the client (also known as the Application ID).

scope.description: The scope to request, multiple scopes are passed delimited by a space character.

OAuthTokenGenerationRequest.description: The entity to request a token, following the OAuth2.0 protocol.

access_token.description: The auth token used when consuming the API endpoints.

expires_in.description: The token expiration time in seconds.

scope.description: The scopes available for the token.

ApplicationId.description: The plain-text Application ID, provided at partner onboarding, also available on Developer Portal.

success.description: Indicates if the partner application successfully created and validated the credential provided through the `Upsert Store Webhook`.

storeId.description: The unique identifier of the store in the partner application. This ID, along with the `Application ID`, will be used to match the correct store when performing operations. It cannot be longer than 255 characters and must only contain printable ASCII characters.

status.description: The new status of the store. ACTIVE: store ready to perform operations again; SUSPENDED: temporarily disables the store; INVALID: current credentials will no longer work, new credentials needed.

message.description: Optional message to explain the reason of the status update.
message.example: Authentication is failing with current credentials.  Suspending store while the retry process is in progress.

id.description: Unique ID for the order that was placed.

source.description: Describes the source of the order, typically from a food ordering marketplace.

OrderIdentifierFinance.description: The external identifiers of the order.

issues.description: Order issues that relate to this item.

pending.description: Whether the transaction can be updated in the future.

currencyCode.description: The 3-letter currency code (ISO 4217) to use for all monetary values in this order.

createdAt.description: The date (in UTC) when the financial transaction was created.

notes.description: General notes about the financial transaction.

issues.description: List of issues that might have happened with the order.

total.description: Total payout value. Should only be used if summary is not provided.

id.description: Unique ID for the order that was placed.

SimpleOrderIdentifierFinance.description: The external identifiers of the order.

createdAt.description: The date (in UTC) when the financial transaction was created.

notes.description: General notes about the financial transaction.

issues.description: List of issues that might have happened with the order.

sourceService.description: Describes the source of the order, typically from a food ordering marketplace.

financialTransactions.description: List of financial transactions related to this invoice.

currencyCode.description: The 3-letter currency code (ISO 4217) to use for all monetary values in this order.

websiteUrl.description: The URL that generated the captcha site key

serviceSlug.description: The slug of the service which is requesting the captcha

action.description: The captcha action available when solving a reCaptcha V3 captcha

CaptchaRequest.description: The request to solve a captcha.

applicationId.description: The plain-text Application ID, provided at partner onboarding, also available on Developer Portal.

resourceId.description: Identifier of the resource that this event refers to, if needed.

payload.description: Object containing details of the given event, if needed.

resourceHref.description: The full endpoint to fetch the details of the resource, if needed.

EventNotification.description: Notification message sent on relevant events.

IntentToCancelEvent.description: Event that request the intent to cancel an order.

status.description: Events that represent updates on order status.

eventTime.description: The time when this OrderStatusUpdateEvent occurred

OrderStatusHistory.description: The Order Status Update History and extra data.

orderAcceptedInfo.description: [NEW] Extra information added once the order was accepted by the restaurant. This field is nullable.

preparationTimeInMinutes.description: [NEW] The time in minutes the restaurant says it will take to prepare the order.

orderId.description: Unique ID for the order that was placed.

OrderReadyEvent.description: Event notifiying that the order has acquired status READY.

orderId.description: Unique ID for the order that was placed.

courierPhone.description: The phone number of the courier.

courierBodyTempFahrenheit.description: The temperature of the courier in fahrenheit.

isCourierWearingMask.description: Whether or not the courier is wearing a mask.

OrderHandedOffEvent.description: Event notifiying that the order has acquired status HANDED OFF.

orderId.description: Unique ID for the order that was placed.

OrderFulfilledEvent.description: Event notifiying that the order has acquired status FULFILLED.

MenuPublishEvent.description: Event data containing the upserted MenuData.

isModifier.description: True, if the item is used as a modifier.

ItemSelector.description: Used to select a specific item.

UpdateItemStatusEntry.description: Update the status of an Item to the provided value.

BulkUpdateItemStatus.description: Event data containing list of item status updates.

UpsertHoursEvent.description: Event data containing all Menu Hours.

UnpauseStoreEvent.description: Closure ID. Required to unpause a store, if available.

provider.description: Describes the provider of the delivery.

currencyCode.description: The 3-letter currency code (ISO 4217) to use for all monetary values.

updatedTime.description: The time that the delivery status was updated.

DeliveryStatusUpdateEvent.description: Event that represent a status update for a delivery.

fullAddress.description: Full, human comprehensible address. It is usually formatted in the order appropriate for your locale. Currently only populated for cases in which only single-line address is available.
fullAddress.example: 123 Sample Street Ste 100, San Francisco, CA 94103

city.description: The city/town portion of the address.

state.description: Highest administrative subdivision which is used for postal addresses of a country or region. For example, this can be a state, a province, or a prefecture.

addressLines.description: Address lines (e.g. street, PO Box, or company name) or the full single line address (e.g. street, city, state, country, zip).
example: 123 Sample Street Ste 100, San Francisco, CA 94103

linesOfAddress.description: Deprecated: use addressLines. Address lines (e.g. street, PO Box, or company name) or the full single line address (e.g. street, city, state, country, zip).
example: 123 Sample Street Ste 100, San Francisco, CA 94103

provider.description: the pre-configured fulfillment provider slug in the onboarding process.

preferredPickupDuration.description: Preferred time for courier to arrive to pick up order. Value expressed in minutes and is relative to time delivery request is made. If not provided, or if the value is 0, please treat it as an ASAP request.

destinationAddress.description: Order destination address. Deprecated in favor of dropoffAddress.

pickUpLocationId.description: An identifier for the pick up location

orderSubTotal.description: The sum of all item and modifier pricing

currencyCode.description: The 3-letter currency code (ISO 4217) to use for all monetary values.

containsAlcoholicItem.description: Whether or not the order contains an alcoholic item.

customerPayments.description: Processed and collectible payments from the customer.

name.description: The person's name as it should be displayed.

phoneCode.description: A code or extension of the phone number.

RequiredPerson.description: Details about the customer who placed the order.

value.description: The amount that the customer tipped.

phone.description: The phone number to contact the store.

quantity.description: Number of units of this modifier being added to the item.

price.description: Per-unit price. This value excludes modifier prices.

quantity.description: Number of units of this item being ordered.

modifiers.description: Any modifiers attached to this item.

readyAtTime.description: The timestamp the order(s) became ready for pick up by a courier. If not provided, the order is not yet ready to be picked up.

provider.description: the pre-configured fulfillment provider slug in the onboarding process.

preferredPickupTime.description: Preferred time for courier to arrive to pick up order. If not provided or if the timestamp is in the past, treat it as an ASAP request.

pickupOrderId.description: An identifier used for picking up order from pickup address.

pickupNote.description: Additional information to instruct couriers how to pickup the order. Deprecated in favor of pickUpInstructions.

dropoffNote.description: Additional information to instruct couriers how to dropoff the order.

customerPayments.description: Processed and collectible payments from the customer.

currencyCode.description: The 3-letter currency code (ISO 4217) to use for all monetary values.

orderSubTotal.description: The sum of all item and modifier pricing

pickUpLocationId.description: An identifier for the pick up location

containsAlcoholicItem.description: Whether or not the order contains an alcoholic item.

pickUpInstructions.description: Additional information to instruct couriers how to pickup the order.

orderItems.description: Items and modifiers in the order.

ofoDisplayId.description: An identifier used to reference the order in the order source.

ofoSlug.description: Slug to identify the OFO that is the source of order.

provider.description: the pre-configured fulfillment provider slug in the onboarding process.

currencyCode.description: The 3-letter currency code (ISO 4217) to use for all monetary values.

customerPayments.description: Processed and collectible payments from the customer.

reportUrl.description: Public URL to download generated report

jobId.description: Job id as returned by /v1/reports call

ReportGeneratedEvent.description: Event data containing metadata of the generated report

currencyCode.description: The currency code for the store.

internalStoreId.description: Our internal store identifier, also known as "SkuSku ID".

credentialsSchemaVersion.description: The version of the credentials schema.

credentials.description: Array of fulfilled credentials containing its keys and values.

EventNotificationBase.description: Notification message sent on relevant events.

CredentialsSchemaVersion.description: The version of the credentials schema.

label.description: The friendly name of the credential.

value.description: The value of the credential. Only returned if the Store ID was provided in the request.

selectOptions.description: options to select when type is `SELECT` or `MULTI_SELECT`

credentials.description: Array of credentials containing its keys, labels and values.

schema.description: A unique identifier of the order in a UUID format.

403.description: Authorization not valid for the requested resource.

422.description: The request body is not valid.

2XX.description: Return any 2XX status to indicate that the data was received successfully
